column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////I went with the fried chicken
column2: as Bavettes' was recently highlighted the dish in an article in Chicago magazine.  Served with a housemade hot sauce and a buttermilk ranch with perfect consistency
column3: the chicken itself was well battered.  The batter itself had a bit of flavor
column4: but it wasn't anything noteworthy.  The meat itself lacked any real flavor
column5: and it was a bit on the dry side.
